section.p: Description: Serial Time Encoded Protocol (STEP) is a non-NRZ, non-PAM signaling architecture, which is referred to as CNVio3 in product design guidelines. CNVio3 (STEP) uses pulse width modulation and operates at a lower fundamental frequency than NRZ for similar data rates. It is a DC coupled asynchronous bus having high bandwidth, low power and small exit latency from low power states. The current version of CNVio3 has a data transfer rate of 12 Gbps to support the Intel WiFi7 integrated solution. Reflections and crosstalk are the primary performance limiters and hence CNVio3 requires a very clean channels.

entry.p: Length matching between P and N within a diff. pair
Single ended equivalent impedance of differential channel
For a differential channel transmission line impedance of 80 Ω, the equivalent required single ended transmission line impedance should be 40 Ω.
It is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads such as M.2 Connector pads/Module pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
- For M.2 connector pads: >= 230 um to the closest ground reference layer.
- For module pads: >= 150 um to the closet ground reference layer.
Max via stub length for Type 3 PTH Vias
Max PTH via stub length is 0.215 mm.
Continuous GND is required on both sides.
Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
CNVio3 BO/BI at the device requires the same impedance as main route. No neckdown into pin field. Refer to “CNVio3 BO/BI at Device Guideline” for more details.
Module pad dimension is 0.4 mm x 0.6 mm. Refer to the “Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements” diagram.
Essential guidelines for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOS
Do not route CNVio3 traces on any layer of the PCB under phase nodes, Inductor and DrMOS.
Differential Impedance of a via should be centered around the characteristic impedance of the channel (±10 Ω tolerance) for Optimum performance.
Maximum via stub for Type 4 Buried PTH Via
Voiding for Type4 buried PTH vias

Need to provide void above and below buried via's PTH pads. Voids need to be 75 um more in radius than pad radius. Void is required as shapes over big pads cause a capacitive dip in impedance which results in lower margins. Please refer to the image provided as a reference.
CNV_RCOMP need to connect to external resistor (200 Ω 1%)
